most_active_tickets.title: VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension
An error occurred in the authentication flow.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and extensions authentication and installation issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty authenticating with Pieces OS on various platforms (Desktop, VS Code, Web Extensions). Issues include authentication flow errors, continuous installation requests for VS Code extension, and inability to access pro features despite being logged in.  Suggested solutions include checking firewall settings, reinstalling Pieces, verifying account status, and ensuring compatibility between Pieces OS and extension versions.

related_issues.title: An error occurred in the authentication flow.
related_issues.text:
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello,
I am receiving this message when attempting to sign-in to Pieces.

```
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
Authentication Error ID: 00000000000000000000000000000000
```

This is a new install. (.appinstaller files)
I have never used the software before.
I do not have a pieces account (yet).
Environment: Windows 11

Launched the authentication by clicking the Sign In button in the Desktop App (4.2.1)
The auth link opened Firefox and generated the error.

I tried the following:
Disabling all extensions in Firefox
Changing my default browser to Edge and re-launching using Edge.
Re-installing with the .exe files.
Reviewed the windows firewall config (Pieces added it itself)
Looked at the Pieces log file but did not see anything obvious enough that I could solve on my own. (See attached)

[log-06252025-copy.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20907036/log-06252025-copy.txt)

Thank you for the help.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension
related_issues.text: VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension. I have installed the extension from VSC, installed all the dependencies multiple times and never able to sign in, never able to launch Pieces from within VSC. I have the desktop running and installed and initialised every time, it makes no difference. I have even added the extension to web browsers and both work flawlessly. See screen shot below. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces Side Bar issues
related_issues.text: Pieces Side Bar issues ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. The screenshot below. After reviewing the errors on GitHub, the error log notes will not save to the pieces os or the desktop. The app for the browser is logged in. This comes to the second issue. I have upgraded my account to the pro version however, even though i am logged in on the same account, i am unable to use the pro settings. As you can see from the image, I am correctly logged in. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces login, account, and extension issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing trouble with Pieces login, account management, and extensions. Issues include old email addresses remaining associated with accounts after changing the email on the provider's side, pro accounts not reflecting the upgrade, and the VS Code extension repeatedly prompting for installation without success despite dependencies being installed and the desktop app working.  The Pieces sidebar also has reported issues with saving error logs.

related_issues.title: Email Addresses Management
related_issues.text:
Email Addresses Management
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.


First, I signed in with my GitHub account. Then, I changed my GitHub email address and logged in with GitHub again. However, it turns out that the old email address is still associated with my account and is still subscribed to the Pieces Newsletter.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

The screenshot below. After reviewing the errors on GitHub, the error log notes will not save to the pieces os or the desktop. The app for the browser is logged in. This comes to the second issue. I have upgraded my account to the pro version however, even though i am logged in on the same account, i am unable to use the pro settings. As you can see from the image, I am correctly logged in. VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension. I have installed the extension from VSC, installed all the dependencies multiple times and never able to sign in, never able to launch Pieces from within VSC. I have the desktop running and installed and initialised every time, it makes no difference. I have even added the extension to web browsers and both work flawlessly. See screen shot below. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving authentication issues impacting Pieces OS, Desktop, VS Code, and Web Extensions. Investigate firewall settings, reinstallation processes, account verification, and version compatibility.
Address the VS Code extension installation problems. Ensure seamless installation and login experience within VS Code.
Investigate and resolve the issue of Pro accounts not reflecting upgrades and the inability to access Pro features despite being logged in.
Fix the Pieces sidebar issue related to saving error logs.
Implement a system to automatically update or remove old email addresses associated with accounts when users change their email on the provider's side.
